snp3.9:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying in a forest near Icchānaṅgala.
snp3.9:1.3: Now at that time several very well-known well-to-do brahmins were residing in Icchānaṅgala. They included
snp3.9:1.4: the brahmins Caṅkī, Tārukkha, Pokkharasāti, Jāṇussoṇi, Todeyya, and others.
snp3.9:1.5: Then as the brahmin students Vāseṭṭha and Bhāradvāja were going for a walk they began to discuss the question:
snp3.9:2.2: “When you’re well born on both your mother’s and father’s side, of pure descent, irrefutable and impeccable in questions of ancestry back to the seventh paternal generation—then you’re a brahmin.”
snp3.9:3.2: “When you’re ethical and accomplished in doing your duties—then you’re a brahmin.”
snp3.9:3.3: But neither was able to persuade the other.
snp3.9:4.2: “Master Bhāradvāja, the ascetic Gotama—a Sakyan, gone forth from a Sakyan family—is staying in a forest near Icchānaṅgala.
snp3.9:4.4: ‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’
snp3.9:4.5: Come, let’s go to see him and ask him about this matter.
snp3.9:4.6: As he answers, so we’ll remember it.”
snp3.9:5.1: So they went to the Buddha and exchanged greetings with him.
snp3.9:5.2: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, they sat down to one side,
snp3.9:5.3: and Vāseṭṭha addressed the Buddha in verse:
snp3.9:7.2: in all the Vedic experts teach.
snp3.9:7.4: we match our teachers in recitation.
snp3.9:8.4: one is a brahmin due to birth,
snp3.9:8.5: but I declare it’s because of one’s actions.
snp3.9:8.6: Oh seer, know this as our debate.
snp3.9:9.1: Since neither of us was able
snp3.9:9.3: we’ve come to ask you, sir,
snp3.9:10.1: As people honor with joined palms
snp3.9:10.2: the moon on the cusp of waxing,
snp3.9:11.2: the eye arisen in the world:
snp3.9:11.3: is one a brahmin due to birth,
snp3.9:11.5: We don’t know, please tell us,
snp3.9:11.6: so that we can know a brahmin.”
snp3.9:14.1: Next there are bugs and moths,
snp3.9:14.2: and so on, to ants and termites.
snp3.9:19.1: While the differences between these species
snp3.9:19.4: are not defined by their birth.
snp3.9:20.1: Not by hair nor by head,
snp3.9:20.2: not by ear nor by eye,
snp3.9:20.3: not by mouth nor by nose,
snp3.9:20.4: not by lips nor by eyebrow,
snp3.9:21.1: not by shoulder nor by neck,
snp3.9:21.2: not by belly nor by back,
snp3.9:21.3: not by buttocks nor by breast,
snp3.9:21.4: not by groin nor by genitals,
snp3.9:22.1: not by hands nor by feet,
snp3.9:22.2: not by fingers nor by nails,
snp3.9:22.3: not by knees nor by thighs,
snp3.9:22.4: not by color nor by voice:
snp3.9:22.5: none of these are defined by birth
snp3.9:22.6: as it is for other species.
